string.text:
Final Day were a faction of scientists, often referred to as "wild stalkers".
 
Also known as Last Day, they believed that the Zone would ultimately bring about the end of the world, claiming and expanding into ever more land with each passing emission.
 
Aside from their fascination with zombified stalkers, and that their now-forgotten leader was assassinated by a stalker called Ghost, little else is known about them.
 
With their activity occurring shortly after the emission that wiped out much of Clear Sky, it is possible they were a small splinter group - survivors who became unhinged from what they had witnessed.

The International Scientific Group was founded to research the Zone.
 
Following the sudden appearance of the Zone, the United Nations created a new research body, with its sole purpose being to research and explain this strange new phenomenon.
 
An area far in the north surrounding six large generators was seen as the most scientifically interesting, and as such was picked as the site for their expedition.
 
Lasting only a few months, their work was plagued by problems they could never have known to prepare for.
 
Researchers would be consumed by unseen anomalies, or ravaged by the horrifically mutated wildlife. Others would inexplicably disappear, only to return days later in a zombified trance trying to kill their colleagues.
 
The expedition was eventually shut down after accomplishing very little, and resulting in an unacceptably high body count.
 
Undeterred by their failure, an institute was created by the Ukrainian government to carry on their work - now commonly referred to as the Ecologists.

Renegades were some of the most despicable stalkers in the Zone.
 
Having no limits or morals, they consisted mainly of stalkers who had committed crimes so terrible that their original factions had cast them out.
 
The only law they respected was one of force, preying on the weak at the perimeters of the Zone, often those who were too young and inexperienced to stand any chance against them.
 
Driven into the marshes by their numerous enemies, it was only in the face of Clear Sky that their desire to survive forced these jackals to unite as a faction of their own.
